data.description: Search your favourite anime by title with this command.
data.extendedHelp:
This command queries Kitsu.io to show data for the anime you request. In a near future, this command will allow you to navigate between the results so you can read the information of the anime.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **query**: The anime's name you are looking for.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, anime *One Piece*
data.name: anime

This command queries Kitsu.io to show data for the manga you request. In a near future, this command', 'will allow you to navigate between the results so you can read the information of the manga.

data.description: Send new announcements, mentioning the announcement role.
data.extendedHelp:
This command requires an announcement channel (**channels.announcement** in the configuration command) which tells Skyra where she should post the announcement messages. Question is, is this command needed? Well, nothing stops you from making your announcements by yourself, however, there are many people who hate being mentioned by at everyone/here. To avoid this, Skyra gives you the option of creating a subscriber role, which is unmentionable (to avoid people spam mentioning the role), and once you run this command, Skyra will set the role to be mentionable, post the message, and back to unmentionable.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **announcement**: The announcement text to post.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, announcement *I am glad to announce that we have a bot able to safely send announcements for our subscribers!*
data.name: announcement

data.description: Subscribe to this server's announcements.
data.extendedHelp:
This command serves the purpose of **giving** you the subscriber role, which must be configured by the server's administrators. When a moderator or administrator use the **announcement** command, you will be mentioned. This feature is meant to replace everyone/here tags and mention only the interested users.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, subscribe
data.name: subscribe

data.description: Unsubscribe from this server's announcements.
data.extendedHelp:
This command serves the purpose of **removing** you the subscriber role, which must be configured by the server's administrators. When a moderator or administrator use the **announcement** command, you will **not longer** be mentioned. This feature is meant to replace everyone/here tags and mention only the interested users.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, unsubscribe
data.name: unsubscribe

data.description: Let me tell you a mysterious cat fact.

I have an existencial doubt... should I wash the dishes or throw them through the window? The search continues. List me items separated by comma and I will choose one them. On a side note, I am not responsible of what happens next.

data.description: Roll the dice, 'x' rolls and 'y' sides.
data.extendedHelp:
The mechanics of this command are easy. You have a dice, then you roll it __x__ times, but the dice can also be configured to have __y__ sides. By default, this command rolls a dice with 6 sides once. However, you can change the amount of rolls for the dice, and this command will 'roll' (get a random number between 1 and the amount of sides). For example, rolling a dice with 6 sides 3 times will leave a random sequence of three random numbers between 1 and 6, for example: 3, 1, 6; And this command will return 10 as output.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **rolls**: Defaults to 1, amount of times the dice should roll.
â†’ **sides**: Defaults to 6, amount of sides the dice should have.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, dice *370 24*
â†’ Skyra, dice *100 6*
â†’ Skyra, dice *6*

â° | ***Reminder***
If you write numbers out of the range between 1 and 1024, Skyra will default the number to 1 or 6.
data.name: dice

"You are already dead" Japanese: ãŠå‰ã¯ã‚‚ã†æ­»ã‚“ã§ã„ã‚‹; Omae Wa Mou Shindeiru, is an expression from the manga and anime series Fist of the North Star. This shows a comic strip of the character pronouncing the aforementioned words, which makes the opponent reply with "nani?" (what?).

data.description: Read comics from XKCD.
data.extendedHelp:
**xkcd** is an archive for nerd comics filled with math, science, sarcasm and languages. If you don't provide any argument, I will get a random comic from xkcd. If you provide a number, I will retrieve the comic with said number. But if you provide a title/text/topic, I will fetch a comic that matches with your input and display it. For example, `Skyra, xkcd Curiosity` will show the comic number 1091.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **query**: Either the number of the comic, or a title to search for.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, xkcd *1091*
â†’ Skyra, xkcd *Curiosity*
data.name: xkcd

data.description: Start a new giveaway.
data.extendedHelp:
This command is designed to manage giveaways. You can start them with this command by giving it the time and a title. When a giveaway has been created, Skyra will send a giveaway message and react to it with ğŸ‰ so the members of the server can participate on it. Once the timer ends, Skyra will retrieve all the users who reacted and send the owner of the giveaway a message in direct messages with the winner, and other 10 possible winners (in case of needing to re-roll).

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **time**: The time the giveaway should last.
â†’ **title**: The title of the giveaway.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, giveaway *6h A hug from Skyra.*
data.name: gstart

data.description: Play Connect-Four with somebody.
data.extendedHelp:
This game is better played on PC. Connect Four (also known as Captain's Mistress, Four Up, Plot Four, Find Four, Four in a Row, Four in a Line and Gravitrips (in Soviet Union)) is a two-player connection game in which the players first choose a color and then take turns dropping colored discs from the top into a seven-column, ~~six~~ five-row vertically suspended grid.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, c4
data.name: c4

data.extendedHelp:
Enough discussion, let the games begin!

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***

data.description: I bet 100<:ShinyYellow:324157128270938113> you ain't winning this round.
data.extendedHelp:
A slot machine (American English), known variously as a fruit machine (British English), puggy (Scottish English),[1] the slots (Canadian and American English), poker machine/pokies (Australian English and New Zealand English), or simply slot (American English), is a casino gambling machine with three or more reels which spin when a button is pushed.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **Amount**: Either 50, 100, 200, 500, or even, 1000 shinies to bet.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, slotmachine

â° | ***Reminder***
You will receive at least 5 times the amount (cherries/tada) at win, and up to 24 times (seven, diamond without skin).
data.name: slotmachine

data.description: Play Tic-Tac-Toe with somebody.
data.extendedHelp:
Tic-tac-toe (also known as noughts and crosses or Xs and Os) is a paper-and-pencil game for two players, X and O, who take turns marking the spaces in a 3Ã—3 grid. The player who succeeds in placing three of their marks in a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal row wins the game.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, tictactoe
data.name: tictactoe

data.description: Prepare the mute system.
data.extendedHelp:
This command prepares the mute system by creating a role called 'muted', and configuring it to the guild settings. This command also modifies all channels (where possible) permissions and disables the permission **Send Messages** in text channels and **Connect** in voice channels for said role.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, createMute
data.name: createmute

data.description: Change Skyra's nickname for this guild.
data.extendedHelp:
This command allows you to change Skyra's nickname easily for the guild.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **nick**: The new nickname. If you don't put any, it'll reset it instead.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, nick *SkyNET*
â†’ Skyra, nick *Assistant*
â†’ Skyra, nick

â° | ***Reminder***
This command requires the **Change Nickname** permission. Make sure Skyra has it.
data.name: nick

data.description: List all public roles from a guild, or claim/unclaim them.
data.extendedHelp:
Public roles? They are roles that are available for everyone, an administrator must configure them with a configuration command.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **Roles**: The list of roles to claim and unclaim. Leave this empty to get a list of roles

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, roles
â†’ Skyra, roles *Designer, Programmer*
â†’ Skyra, roles *Designer*

â° | ***Reminder***
When using claim/unclaim, the roles can be individual, or multiple. To claim multiple roles, you must separate them by a comma. You can specify which roles by writting their ID, name, or a section of the name.
data.name: roles

data.description: Set custom triggers for your guild.
data.extendedHelp:
This command allows administrators to go further with the personalization of Skyra in the guild. A trigger is a piece that can active other functions. For example, the aliases are triggers that get executed when the command does not exist in bot, triggering the unknown command event. When this happens, the alias system executes and tries to find an entry that matches with the input.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **list**: List all current triggers.
â†’ **add <type> <input> <output>**: Add a new trigger given a type, input and output.
â†’ **remove <type> <input>**: Remove a trigger given the type and input.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, triggers
â†’ Skyra, triggers *list*
â†’ Skyra, triggers *add reaction "good night" ğŸŒ›*
â†’ Skyra, triggers *remove reaction "good night"*

â° | ***Reminder***
This command requires the **Add Reactions** permission so it can test reactions. Make sure Skyra has it.
data.name: triggers

Well, what can I tell you? This command turns your messages into unicode monospaced characters. That is, what humans call 'ï¼¡ ï¼¥ ï¼³ ï¼´ ï¼¨ ï¼¥ ï¼´ ï¼© ï¼£'. I wonder what it means...

data.description: Hit somebody with the ban hammer.
data.extendedHelp:
This command requires **Ban Members**, and only members with lower role hierarchy position can be banned by me. No, the guild's owner cannot be banned. This action can be optionally timed to create a temporary ban.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, ban *@Pete*
â†’ Skyra, ban *@Pete Spamming all channels.*
â†’ Skyra, ban *@Pete Spamming all channels, for 24 hours.*
data.name: ban

data.description: Hit somebody with the ğŸ‘¢.
data.extendedHelp:
This command requires **Kick Members**, and only members with lower role hierarchy position can be kicked by me. No, the guild's owner cannot be kicked.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, kick *@Pete*
â†’ Skyra, kick *@Pete Spamming general chat.*
data.name: kick

data.description: Close the gates for this channel!
data.extendedHelp:
This command requires **Manage Channels** in order to be able to manage the permissions for a channel. This command removes the permission **Send Messages** to the `@everyone` role so nobody but the members with roles that have their own overrides (besides administrators, who bypass channel overrides) can send messages. Optionally, you can pass time as second argument.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, lockdown
â†’ Skyra, lockdown *#general*
â†’ Skyra, lockdown *#general 5m*
data.name: lockdown

data.description: Mute a user in all text and voice channels.
data.extendedHelp:
This command requires **Manage Roles**, and only members with lower role hierarchy position can be managed by me. No, the guild's owner cannot be muted. This action can be optionally timed to create a temporary mute. This action saves a member's roles temporarily and will be granted to the user after the unmute. The muted role is **sticky**, if the user tries to remove it by rejoining the guild, it will be added back.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, mute *@Pete*
â†’ Skyra, mute *@Pete Spamming all channels*
â†’ Skyra, mute *@Pete Spamming all channels, for 24 hours.*
data.name: mute

data.description: Prunes a certain amount of messages w/o filter.
data.extendedHelp:
This command deletes the given amount of messages given a filter within the last 100 messages sent in the channel the command has been run.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **Messages**: The amount of messages to prune.
â†’ **Filter**: The filter to apply.
â†’ **(Filter) Link**: Filters messages that have links on the content.
â†’ **(Filter) Invite**: Filters messages that have invite links on the content.
â†’ **(Filter) Bots**: Filters messages sent by bots.
â†’ **(Filter) You**: Filters messages sent by Skyra.
â†’ **(Filter) Me**: Filters your messages.
â†’ **(Filter) Upload**: Filters messages that have attachments.
â†’ **(Filter) User**: Filters messages sent by the specified user.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, prune *50 me*
â†’ Skyra, prune *75 @kyra*
â†’ Skyra, prune *20 bots*

â° | ***Reminder***
Due to a Discord limitation, bots cannot delete messages older than 14 days.
data.name: prune

data.description: Edit the reason field from a moderation log case.
data.extendedHelp:
This command allows moderation log case management, it allows moderators to update the reason.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, reason *420 Spamming all channels*
â†’ Skyra, reason *419..421 Bad memes*
â†’ Skyra, reason *latest Woops, I did a mistake!*
data.name: reason

data.description: Hit somebody with the ban hammer, destroying all their messages for some days, and unban it.
data.extendedHelp:
This command requires **Ban Members**, and only members with lower role hierarchy position can be banned by me. No, the guild's owner cannot be banned. The ban feature from Discord has a feature that allows the moderator to remove all messages from all channels that have been sent in the last 'x' days, being a number between 0 (no days) and 7. The user gets unbanned right after the ban, so it is like a kick, but that can prune many many messages.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, softban *@Pete*
â†’ Skyra, softban *@Pete Spamming all channels*
â†’ Skyra, softban *@Pete 7 All messages sent in 7 are gone now, YEE HAH!*
data.name: softban

data.description: Unban somebody from this guild.
data.extendedHelp:
This command requires **Ban Members**. It literally gets somebody from the rubbish bin, cleans them up, and allows the pass to this guild's gates.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, unban *@Pete*
â†’ Skyra, unban *@Pete Turns out he was not the one who spammed all channels Â¯\_(ãƒ„)_/Â¯*
data.name: unban

data.description: Remove the scotch tape from a user.
data.extendedHelp:
This command requires **Manage Roles** and removes a user from the muted people's list, and gives the old roles back if the user had them.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, unmute *@Pete*
â†’ Skyra, unmute *@Pete (Insert random joke here).*
data.name: unmute

data.description: Appeal a warning moderation log case.
data.extendedHelp:
This command appeals a warning, it requires no permissions, you only give me the moderation log case to appeal and the reason.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, unwarn *0 Whoops, wrong dude.*
â†’ Skyra, unwarn *42 Turns out this was the definition of life.*
data.name: unwarn

data.description: Throw somebody's microphone out the window.
data.extendedHelp:
This command requires **Mute Members**, and only members with lower role hierarchy position can be silenced by me. No, the guild's owner cannot be silenced. This action can be optionally timed to create a temporary voice mute.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, vmute *@Pete*
â†’ Skyra, vmute *@Pete Singing too loud*
â†’ Skyra, vmute *@Pete Literally sang hear rape, for 24 hours.*
data.name: vmute

data.description: Hit somebody with the ğŸ‘¢ for singing so bad and loud.
data.extendedHelp:
This command requires the permissions **Manage Channels** to create a temporary (hidden) voice channel, and **Move Members** to move the user to the temporary channel. After this, the channel is quickly deleted, making the user leave the voice channel. For scared moderators, this command has almost no impact in the average user, as the channel is created in a way only me and the selected user can see and join, then quickly deleted.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, voicekick *@Pete*
â†’ Skyra, voicekick *@Pete Spamming all channels*
data.name: voicekick

data.description: Get somebody's microphone back so they can talk.
data.extendedHelp:
This command requires **Mute Members**, and only members with lower role hierarchy position can be un-silenced by me. No, the guild's owner cannot be un-silenced.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, vunmute *@Pete*
â†’ Skyra, vunmute *@Pete Appealed his times signing hear rape.*
data.name: vunmute

data.description: (ADM) List or configure the autoroles for a guild.
data.extendedHelp:
Autoroles? They are roles that are available for everyone, and automatically given when they reach an amount of (local) points, an administrator must configure them through a setting command.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **list**: Lists all the current autoroles.
â†’ **add <amount> <role>**: Add a new autorole.
â†’ **remove <role>**: Remove an autorole from the list.
â†’ **update <amount> <role>**: Change the required amount of points for an existing autorole.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, autorole *list*
â†’ Skyra, autorole *add 20000 Trusted Member*
â†’ Skyra, autorole *update 15000 Trusted Member*
â†’ Skyra, autorole *remove Trusted Member*

â° | ***Reminder***
The current system grants a random amount of points between 4 and 8 points, for each post with a 1 minute cooldown.
data.name: autorole

data.description: Get information about how to donate to keep Skyra alive longer.

Skyra Project started on 24th October 2016, if you are reading this, you are using the version 5.1.0 Nerom, which is the twelfth rewrite. I have improved a lot every single function from Skyra, and now, she is extremely fast.  However, not everything is free, I need your help to keep Skyra alive in a VPS so you can enjoy her functions longer. I will be very thankful if you help me, really, I have been working on a lot of things, but she is my beautiful baby, take care of her â¤  Do you want to support this amazing project? Feel free to do so! https://www.patreon.com/kyranet

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***

data.description: Manage this guilds' tags.
data.extendedHelp:
What are tags? Tags are chunk of texts stored under a name, which allows you, for example, you can do `Skyra, tag rule1` and get a response with what the rule number one of your server is. Besides that, tags are also used for memes, who doesn't like memes?

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **action**: The action to perform: **add** to add new tags, **remove** to delete them, and **edit** to edit them.
â†’ **tag**: The tag's name.
â†’ **contents**: Required for the actions **add** and **edit**, specifies the content for the tag.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, tag *add rule1 Respect other users. Harassment, hatespeech, etc... will not be tolerated.*
â†’ Skyra, tag *edit rule1 Just be respectful with the others.*
â†’ Skyra, tag *rule1*
â†’ Skyra, tag *source rule1*
â†’ Skyra, tag *remove rule1*
â†’ Skyra, tag *list*
data.name: tag

data.description: Manage polls.
data.extendedHelp:
The poll command creates a poll and tracks any vote, whilst also offering filters and unique votes (users can't vote twice nor two different options). You can customize the available options for the user and it features role and user whitelist. At the end of the poll, Skyra will DM you the results with a chart, make sure to have your DMs opened! After the vote concludes (they require time), you can retrieve the results for 24 hours before it gets unaccesible.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, poll *create Should I create the #anime channel? --options="yes,no,definitely"*
â†’ Skyra, poll *list*
â†’ Skyra, poll *vote jfutdsxsb yes*
â†’ Skyra, poll *result jfutdsxsb*
â†’ Skyra, poll *remove jfutdsxsb*

â° | ***Reminder***
Skyra will prompt you for user and role whitelist, you can omit it by including `--no-prompt` in your message or specify them with `--users="id1,id2..." and --roles="id1,id2..."`. If you want something simpler, use the `spoll` command.
data.name: poll

data.description: Display help for a command.
data.extendedHelp: No extended help available.
data.name: help

data.description: Manage attachment management in this guild.
data.extendedHelp:
This command manages the attachment management for me in this guild.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **maximum <maximum>**: The maximum amount of attachments allowed.
â†’ **duration <duration>**: The lifetime for the attachments in the system.
â†’ **action <ban|kick|mute|softban>**: Defines the action I will take once a user breaks the threshold.
â†’ **logs <y|yes|n|no>**: Defines whether or not should I log when somebody breaks the threshold.
â†’ **enable**: Enables the attachment filter.
â†’ **disable**: Disables the attachment filter.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, manageAttachments *maximum 25*
â†’ Skyra, manageAttachments *duration 1m*
â†’ Skyra, manageAttachments *action mute*
â†’ Skyra, manageAttachments *logs y*
â†’ Skyra, manageAttachments *enable*
â†’ Skyra, manageAttachments *disable*
data.name: manageattachments

data.description: Manage this guild's flags for the caps filter.
data.extendedHelp:
There are three flags in the caps filter, each enable or disable a function:
- **Alert**: Whether or not the user should get a notification in the channel after reaching the threshold.
- **Log**: Whether or not the caps filter should log to the moderation log channel when it triggers.
- **Delete**: Whether or not the caps filter should delete the message.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, setCapsFilter
data.name: setcapsfilter

data.description: Manage per-channel command blacklist.
data.extendedHelp:
This command manages this guild's per-channel command blacklist, it serves well to disable certain commands you do not want to be used in certain channels (to disable a command globally, use the `disabledCommands` settings key to disable in all channels.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **show [channel]**: Show the command blacklist for the selected channel
â†’ **add [channel] <command>**: Add a command to the specified channel's command blacklist.
â†’ **remove [channel] <command>**: Remove a command to the specified channel's command blacklist.
â†’ **reset [channel]**: Clear the command blacklist for the specified channel.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, manageCommandChannel *show*
â†’ Skyra, manageCommandChannel *add #general profile*
â†’ Skyra, manageCommandChannel *remove #general profile*
â†’ Skyra, manageCommandChannel *reset #general*

â° | ***Reminder***
The channel argument is optional, but it uses fuzzy search when possible.
data.name: managecommandchannel

data.description: Manage the role reactions.
data.extendedHelp:
This command manages the role reaction module, it requires a **role channel** set up and the permissions **Add Reactions** and **Read Message History** to be able to validate and operate correctly.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **show**: Show all the currently configured role reactions.
â†’ **add <role> <emoji>**: Add a new role reaction with the role ID or name, and a valid emoji.
â†’ **remove <emoji>**: Remove a role reaction by its configured emoji.
â†’ **reset**: Reset all the current role reactions.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, manageRoleReaction *show*
â†’ Skyra, manageRoleReaction *add Baited ğŸµ*
â†’ Skyra, manageRoleReaction *add "Looking for Group" ğŸ®*
â†’ Skyra, manageRoleReaction *remove ğŸ®*
â†’ Skyra, manageRoleReaction *reset*

â° | ***Reminder***
You cannot set the same emoji twice, and Skyra may remove role reactions automatically if she loses permissions or they are removed.
data.name: managerolereaction

data.description: Set a channel to the ignore channel list.
data.extendedHelp:
This command helps you setting up ignored channels. An ignored channel is a channel where nobody but moderators can use Skyra's commands. Unlike removing the **Send Messages** permission, Skyra is still able to send (and therefore execute commands) messages, which allows moderators to use moderation commands in the channel. Use this if you want to ban any command usage from the bot in a specific channel.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **channel**: A TextChannel. You can either put the name of the channel, tag it, or type in "here" to select the channel the message was sent.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, setIgnoreChannels *#general*
â†’ Skyra, setIgnoreChannels *here*

â° | ***Reminder***
You cannot set the same channel twice, instead, Skyra will remove it.
data.name: setignorechannels

data.description: Set the member logs channel.
data.extendedHelp:
This command helps you setting up the member log channel. A member log channel only sends two kinds of logs: "Member Join" and "Member Leave". If a muted user joins, it will send a special "Muted Member Join" event. All messages are in embeds so you will need to enable the permission **Embed Links** for Skyra. You also need to individually set the "events" you want to listen: "events.memberAdd" and "events.memberRemove". For roles, you would enable "events.memberNicknameChange" and/or "events.memberRolesChange" via the "config" command.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **channel**: A TextChannel. You can either put the name of the channel, tag it, or type in "here" to select the channel the message was sent.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, setMemberLogs *#member-logs*
â†’ Skyra, setMemberLogs *here*
data.name: setmemberlogs

data.description: Set the message logs channel.
data.extendedHelp:
This command helps you setting up the message log channel. A message log channel only sends three kinds of logs: "Message Delete", "Message Edit", and "Message Prune". All messages are in embeds so you will need to enable the permission **Embed Links** for Skyra. You also need to individually set the "events" you want to listen: "events.messageDelete", "events.messageEdit", and "events.messagePrune" via the "config" command.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **channel**: A TextChannel. You can either put the name of the channel, tag it, or type in "here" to select the channel the message was sent.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, setMessageLogs *#message-logs*
â†’ Skyra, setMessageLogs *here*

â° | ***Reminder***
Due to Discord limitations, Skyra cannot know who deleted a message. The only way to know is by fetching audit logs, requiring the permission **View Audit Log** which access is limited in the majority of guilds and the amount of times I can fetch them in a period of time.
data.name: setmessagelogs

data.description: Set the mod logs channel.
data.extendedHelp:
This command helps you setting up the mod log channel. A mod log channel only sends case reports indexed by a number case and with "claimable" reasons and moderators. This channel is not a must and you can always retrieve specific modlogs with the "case" command. All messages are in embeds so you will need to enable the permission **Embed Links** for Skyra. For auto-detection, you need to individually set the "events" you want to listen: "events.banAdd", "events.banRemove" via the "config" command.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **channel**: A TextChannel. You can either put the name of the channel, tag it, or type in "here" to select the channel the message was sent.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, setModLogs *#mod-logs*
â†’ Skyra, setModLogs *here*

â° | ***Reminder***
Due to Discord limitations, the auto-detection does not detect kicks. You need to use the "kick" command if you want to document them as a formal moderation log case.
data.name: setmodlogs

data.description: Set Skyra's prefix.
data.extendedHelp:
This command helps you setting up Skyra's prefix. A prefix is an affix that is added in front of the word, in this case, the message. It allows bots to distinguish between a regular message and a command. By nature, the prefix between should be different to avoid conflicts. If you forget Skyra's prefix, simply mention her with nothing else and she will tell you the current prefix. Alternatively, you can take advantage of Skyra's NLP (Natural Language Processing) and prefix the commands with her name and a comma. For example, "Skyra, ping".

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **prefix**: The prefix to set. Default one in Skyra is "s!".

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, setPrefix *&*
â†’ Skyra, setPrefix *=*

â° | ***Reminder***
Your prefix should only contain characters everyone can write and type.
data.name: setprefix

data.description: Set the role channel for role reactions.
data.extendedHelp:
This command sets up the role channel to lock the reactions to, it is a requirement to set up before setting up the **role message**, and if none is given, the role reactions module will not run.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **channel**: A TextChannel. You can either put the name of the channel, tag it, or type in "here" to select the channel the message was sent.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, setRoleChannel *#roles*
â†’ Skyra, setRoleChannel *here*

â° | ***Reminder***
You cannot set the same channel twice, instead, Skyra will remove it.
data.name: setrolechannel

data.description: Set the role message for role reactions.
data.extendedHelp:
This command sets up the role message to lock the reactions to, it requires a **role channel** to be set up first, and if none is given, Skyra will listen to any reaction in the channel. Additionally, Skyra requires **Read Message History** in order to fetch the message for validation.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **message**: An ID, they are 17-18 characters long and numeric.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, setRoleMessage *434096799847022598*

â° | ***Reminder***
You must execute this command in the role channel.
data.name: setrolemessage

data.description: Set the emoji reaction for starboard.
data.extendedHelp:
This command sets up the starboard emoji for the starboard, which is, by default, â­. Once this is changed, Skyra will ignore any star and will count users who reacted to said emoji.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **emoji**: The emoji to set.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, setStarboardEmoji *â­*

â° | ***Reminder***
Use this wisely, not everyone expects the starboard to listen to a custom emoji.
data.name: setstarboardemoji

data.description: Check the information of the guild.
data.extendedHelp:
The serverinfo command displays information for the guild the message got sent. It shows the amount of channels, with the count for each category, the amount of members (given from the API), the owner with their user id, the amount of roles, region, creation date, verification level... between others.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, serverinfo
data.name: guildinfo

data.description: Check the information for a role.
data.extendedHelp:
The roleinfo command displays information for a role, such as its id, name, color, whether it's hoisted (displays separately) or not, it's role hierarchy position, whether it's mentionable or not, how many members have said role, and its permissions. It sends an embedded message with the color of the role.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **role**: The role name, partial name, mention or id.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, roleinfo *Administrator*
â†’ Skyra, roleinfo *Moderator*
â†’ Skyra, roleinfo
data.name: roleinfo

data.description: Manage sticky roles for users.
data.extendedHelp:
The stickyRoles command allows you to manage per-member's sticky roles, they are roles that are kept even when you leave, and are applied back as soon as they join.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **action**: Either you want to check the sticky roles, add one, remove one, or remove all of them.
â†’ **user**: The user target for all the actions.
â†’ **role**: The role to add or remove.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, stickyRoles *add Skyra Goddess*
â†’ Skyra, stickyRoles *show Skyra*
â†’ Skyra, stickyRoles *remove Skyra Goddess*
â†’ Skyra, stickyRoles *reset Skyra*

â° | ***Reminder***
The member's roles will not be modified by this command, you need to add or remove them.
data.name: stickyroles

data.description: Manage this guild's word blacklist.
data.extendedHelp:
The filter command manages the word blacklist for this server and must have a filter mode set up, check `Skyra, help setFilterMode`. Skyra's word filter can find matches even with special characters or spaces between the letters of a blacklisted word, as well as it filters duplicated characters for enhanced filtering.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, filter
data.name: filter

data.description: Manage this guild's word blacklist mode.
data.extendedHelp:
The setFilterMode command manages the mode of the word blacklist, in Skyra, there are three modes: **Disabled** (the default value) which as its name suggests, it disables the word filter; **DeleteOnly**, which deletes the message; **LogOnly**, which does not delete the message but instead sends a modlog; and **All**, which enables both message deletion and logging.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, setFilterMode

â° | ***Reminder***
Both **LogOnly** and **All** modes require the key `channels.modlogs` to be set up.
data.name: setfiltermode

data.description: Display the count of moderation cases from this guild or from a user.
data.extendedHelp:
This command shows the amount of bans, mutes, kicks, and warnings, including temporary, that have not been appealed.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, history
â†’ Skyra, history *@Pete*
data.name: history

data.description: List all warnings from this guild or from a user.
data.extendedHelp:
This command shows either all warnings filed in this guild, or all warnings filed in this guild for a specific user. This command uses a reaction-based menu and requires the permission **Manage Messages** to execute correctly.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, warnings
â†’ Skyra, warnings *@Pete*
data.name: warnings

data.description: Get the information from a case by its index.
data.extendedHelp: No extended help available.
data.name: case

data.name: flow

data.description: Configure this guild's member points.
data.extendedHelp:
This command allows for updating other members' points.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **set <user> <amount>**: Sets an amount of points to the user.
â†’ **add <user> <amount>**: Adds an amount of points to the user.
â†’ **remove <user> <amount>**: Removes an amount of points from the user.
â†’ **reset <user>**: Resets all pointss from the user.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, social *set @kyra 40000*
â†’ Skyra, social *add @kyra 2400*
â†’ Skyra, social *remove @kyra 3000*
â†’ Skyra, social *reset @kyra*
data.name: social

data.description: Configure the banner for your profile.
data.extendedHelp:
Banners are vertical in Skyra, they decorate your profile card.

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **list**: (Default) Lists all available banners.
â†’ **reset**: Set your displayed banner to default.
â†’ **buy <bannerID>**: Buy a banner, must be an ID.
â†’ **set <bannerID>**: Set your displayed banner, must be an ID.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, banner *list*
â†’ Skyra, banner *buy 0w1p06*
â†’ Skyra, banner *set 0w1p06*
â†’ Skyra, banner *reset*
data.name: banner

data.description: Check the definition of a word.
data.extendedHelp:
What does "heel" mean?

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **Word**: The word or phrase you want to get the definition from.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, define *heel*
data.name: define

data.description: Check the definition of a word on UrbanDictionary.
data.extendedHelp:
What does "spam" mean?

âš™ | ***Explained usage***
â†’ **Word**: The word or phrase you want to get the definition from.
â†’ **Page**: Defaults to 1, the page you wish to read.

ğŸ”— | ***Examples***
â†’ Skyra, urban *spam*
data.name: urban
